entry.content:
I was laid off for the first time in my professional career this week. My (previous) company dropped about 30% of its workforce.
All in all, it isn't so bad. They paid good severance and it looks like the labor market is still pretty strong in my area (software engineering). I will also likely get a significant pay bump in my next position.
And yet the entire process has just kinda left my feeling crummy. I (obviously) knew that this sort of thing can happen but the immediate impact of my career and (short term) livelihood being in the hands of someone I don't know -- where I am just basically a row on a spreadsheet that they're washing their hands of -- does not feel good. I also really liked the people I worked with (and this seems really hard to screen for ahead of time IMO, more of a crapshoot) and we worked remotely throughout the country, so will likely not really every see one another again.
My life is pretty hectic at home with a young child at the moment but I definitely want to start thinking about diversifying my income stream outside of just one job.
Not sure the point of this post, just venting I guess.
